numberOfSeatsInstructions:
Number of seats

Set how many candidates will be elected in this contest.
The value cannot be less than 1 or more than the total number of candidates.
addCandidatesInstructions:
Add your candidates

Enter candidate names below.
- Click Add Candidate to add more.
- Click Remove to delete a candidate.
- You can rename candidates at any time.
You can change the candidate's name here: You can change the candidate's name here.
At least one candidate is required: At least one candidate is required
Click to add a new candidate to the list: Click to add a new candidate to the list
editBallotsInstructions:
How to edit ballots:
- Enter the number of voters represented by each ballot.
- Rank the candidates (1 = first choice, 2 = second, ...); leave blank for "no preference".
- Candidates ranked equally are counted equally.
- Use Add Ballot group for new voting groups.
- Remove ballots you don't need.
loadSaveYamlInstructions:
Load/Save election YAML
Paste valid YAML to update the election setup.
Copy this field to export the current configuration.
Changes will apply automatically if the YAML is valid.
methodology:
This website runs the Single Transferable Vote (STV) using Meek's method using Droop quota, a precise and widely recognized algorithm for proportional ranked-choice elections.
This is the same type of method used in various real-world governmental and organizational elections.

The underlying algorithm is implemented in open source by Guillaume Endignoux, an engineer at Google.
It can be found [here](https://github.com/gendx/stv-rs) and explained [here](https://gendignoux.com/blog/2023/03/27/single-transferable-vote.html).

By default, STV selects a set of winners, but does not provide a strict ranking of those elected.
To provide a podium-style order, this website augments the STV results by ranking the elected candidates using [Copeland's method](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copeland%27s_method),
a well-known approach based on pairwise comparison of preferences across all ballots.
Specifically, candidates are first selected by STV, and then their order is determined according to voter preferences using Copeland's method.
